string-array.name: introduction_message
string-array.item: 1.In Sudoku, you place a number from 1 to 9 in each blank cell.
3.Each rows (there are nine rows), and columns (there are also nine columes) contain numbers from 1 through 9.
4.Also, 3x3 blocks bounded by bold lines (nine blocks) contain numbers from 1 through 9.
5.This is an example of answer. Lock at the top row colored in light blue. Each cell in the line contains numbers 1 through 9.
6.Please check the left column colored in blue also contain every number from 1 to 9.
7.And, the colored 3x3 block contains numbers from 1 to 9.
8.Checking numbers helps you to find a good starting point. First, look at rows and columns.
9.Since, as for the 3x3 block on the left hand-side, 1 is already contained in the upper row and middle at the right, therefore, 1 is not placed in the cell.
10.Would be the only cell that wounld contain 1.
11.In this figure, 1 goes into similarly.
12.Also in this figure, 1 goes into.
13.Again, 1 goes into.
15.Here is a little tip for advanced folks. As you can see, in top left 3x3 block, there are two cells that may contain 1.
16.One of the should have 1, So that you cannot place 1 in blue cells.
17.Since 1 does not go into the blue cell, you can safely assume that 1 goes into.
18.There are many more tips.Try discovering your own as you go along.
